message_1:
Given the predicate P(x,y) = "x is divisible by y", where x and y are integers, what is the truth value of the statement: 

∀ x ∈ Z, ∃ y ∈ Z such that P(x,y)
message_2:
The statement ∀ x ∈ Z, ∃ y ∈ Z such that P(x,y) is true.

For every integer x, there exists an integer y such that x is divisible by y. This is because every integer x is divisible by 1 and itself (x). So, for any given x, you can always find a y (either 1 or x) that satisfies the predicate P(x,y).
